bug.author: PhilLab
bug.summary: Invalid YML when storing strings containing only spaces
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>Please state the information for your system</denchmark-h>


OpenCV version: 3.1

<denchmark-h:h3>In which part of the OpenCV library you got the issue?</denchmark-h>


persistence

<denchmark-h:h3>Expected behaviour</denchmark-h>

Strings containing only spaces should be serialized as key: "    "
<denchmark-h:h3>Actual behaviour</denchmark-h>

Such strings are serialized as key:, breaking the indentation. When reading the file again, OpenCV crashes with the exception

OpenCV Error: Parsing error (dummy.yml(3): Incorrect indentation) in icvYMLSkipSpaces

The file generated by the code below looks like this:
<denchmark-code>%YAML:1.0
test:  
test2: other
</denchmark-code>

<denchmark-h:h3>Additional description</denchmark-h>

<denchmark-h:h3>Code example to reproduce the issue / Steps to reproduce the issue</denchmark-h>

Please try to give a full example which will compile as is.
<denchmark-code>#include <opencv2/core.hpp>
#include <iostream>

int main(int argc, char **argv)
{
    cv::FileStorage fs("dummy.yml", cv::FileStorage::WRITE);
    fs << "test" << "    ";
    fs << "test2" << "other";
    fs.release();
    cv::FileStorage fs2("dummy.yml", cv::FileStorage::READ);
    std::string test;
    fs2["test"] >> test;
    std::cout << "test is: " << test << std::endl;
    return 0;
} //main
</denchmark-code>
